definition: to rack one's brains for schemes (idiom)/to beat one's brains out
surname Fei
to cost/to spend/fee/wasteful/expenses
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
machine/engine/opportunity/intention/aircraft/pivot/crucial point/flexible (quick-witted)/organic/CL:臺|台[tai2]
surname Ji

sentences.english: With a period of only thee weeks, five prisoners succeeded in escaping from the prison.
sentences.chinese: 那囚犯費盡心機找一個越獄的辦法，他終於成功了。

sentences.english: You and all your classmates have struggled to get jobs since graduation.
sentences.chinese: 畢業後您和您所有的同學都爲求職費盡心機。

sentences.english: Others are trying their best to approach teachers in order to find out some examination questions.
sentences.chinese: 有人費盡心機地接近老師，爲了套出些考題。

sentences.english: This is the painting which he worried out.
sentences.chinese: 這就是他費盡心機搞到手的那幅油畫。

sentences.english: Then one day, you will find that the things you try hard to forget are already one.
sentences.chinese: 原本是費盡心機想要忘記的事情真的就那麼忘記了。

sentences.english: You tried to teach me right from wrong .
sentences.chinese: 您費盡心機學人是非分明。

sentences.english: So finally photographed the wall of the banana.
sentences.chinese: 於是費盡心機拍到了圍牆外的香蕉樹。

definition: lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
indirect, psychological method of getting sb to do as one wishes (e.g. questioning whether they are up to the task)
stupid and ignorant (idiom)
druggist
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
equestrianism/horsemanship
red in the face/extremely angry
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
not one good point/everything about it is wrong
to hog/to keep everything for oneself
talented field commander (military)
sequel/continuation of a book
to praise the virtue of sb or sth while concealing their faults
